revisionDesc.change: moved notes to external file and added ptrs; checked
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Corrected date and date format. Justified newly certain date.
checked metadata and encoding and revised as necessary
Replaced smart quotes with straight; removed external URL links.
Changed straight quotes to character reference smart quotes.

body.p:
wasent wasn't it good to get that from george and so lately i began to feel worried at not hearing from him in so long i read the names in the times to day today but georges was not amongst them they were all officers Captain Cook was very good to send me such A kind note you know i suppose whoo who he is brother to the one you went to see Cook and voluntary he must have been exchanged it came from Anappolis Annapolis without any stamp wrote on it soldiers letter O i was very glad indeed to hear from him i just got it A few minuts minutes before
Jeffy was going down to the office so we sent it to you) well Walt how are you getting along well i hope) i can appreciate your bad feelings you had in your head i have been affected with the same feelings but i feel better of it to day today it seemed like as if there was A dozen crickets singing in my head i think i over worked i was fixing A bedroom for George and tried to get mrs Howard to whitewash but i could not i offered her 1 dol dollar an half for one day but she did not come matty does not have her any more so she did
not come so bye reaching up probably was the cause of my bad feelings and i had A bad could cold in my head i could not sleep at nights but i feel better to day today but as soon as i go to work i feel so very weak and bad i dident didn't say much about it but it is A very disagreable disagreeable feeling Jeffy is going to the oil regions to survey to morrow tomorrow and he says if he can he will come to Washington before he returns we have not heard from Jesse since you was there if you have Walter i wish you would write about it when you write to me i must give you A list Walt of my domestic
affairs well to begin with the beef came but was rather A failure it was more per lb than it was to have been and was 17lb short of weight well it had to be paid for) and i have got A cheap carpet or cheap for these times the old carpet is all played out wel well i drawed all my money out off the bank there was only 100) 50 dollar it was all right Jeffy see to it i have paid my rent up to the first of may May and am square with the grocery land am out of money great mama aint ain't she so walt you must send some so as i can keep along i dont don't want to take up any of Georges till i see what he says when he comes
